output.conclusion: This course provides a comprehensive understanding of time series analysis techniques, enabling you to effectively model, forecast, and interpret time-dependent data.
output.introduction: Welcome to Advanced Time Series Analysis! This course delves into sophisticated methods for analyzing and forecasting time series data, building upon foundational knowledge. We will explore advanced models, spectral analysis, and state-space models, equipping you with the tools to tackle complex real-world problems.

chapters.chapterTitle: Introduction to Advanced Time Series Concepts
chapters.description: Review of basic time series concepts (stationarity, autocorrelation). Introduction to advanced topics: non-linear models, multivariate time series, and state-space representations.
Advanced stationarity tests (KPSS, ADF-GLS). Techniques for variance stabilization (Box-Cox transformations) and trend removal (differencing, detrending).
Information criteria (AIC, BIC, HQIC) for model selection. Cross-validation techniques for time series data. Model diagnostics and residual analysis.
Seasonal ARIMA (SARIMA) models. ARIMA models with exogenous variables (ARIMAX). Intervention analysis and outlier detection.
Introduction to non-linear models: Threshold Autoregressive (TAR) models, Smooth Transition Autoregressive (STAR) models. Neural network models for time series.
Introduction to volatility modeling: ARCH and GARCH models. Extensions of GARCH models: EGARCH, GJR-GARCH. Applications in finance.
Introduction to spectral analysis: Fourier transform, periodogram. Windowing techniques for spectral estimation.
Parametric spectral estimation methods (AR, MA, ARMA). Applications of spectral analysis: signal processing, climate analysis.
Introduction to wavelet analysis: continuous and discrete wavelet transforms. Applications of wavelet analysis: denoising, feature extraction.
Introduction to state-space models: Kalman filter, Kalman smoother. Model formulation and estimation.
Applications in time series forecasting, signal extraction, and parameter estimation. Dynamic linear models.
Vector Autoregression (VAR) models. Cointegration and error correction models. Applications in economics and finance.
